abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Transport Sector Adjustment Project in
            Chad. The main objectives of the project were to: (a)
            reorganize the transport sector's public institutions
            and implement this reorganization with the help of a newly
            created Inter-ministerial Project Monitoring and
            Coordination Unit (IPMCU); (b) promote liberalization
            measures in the transport sector; (c) enhance the
            development of the private sector in road works and
            construction materials production; (d) rehabilitate 1,800 km
            of the priority road network with the assistance of several
            co-financiers; and (e) reduce the cost of transportation and
            improve financial resource mobilization for funding road
            maintenance. The results of the project differed markedly
            across components: the sector policy component was a good
            achievement, but the physical accomplishments fell short of
            project targets. Aside from the underestimation of the costs
            during preparation of the project, and the absence of
            performance monitoring indicators in the Memorandum to the
            President's Report which could have contributed to
            improve the Borrower's performance, the Bank's
            performance can be considered satisfactory. The main lesson
            to be drawn from the project is that road maintenance is
            very costly and that owing to the country's limited
            financial capabilities judicious selection of priorities
            during the Public Expenditure Review must be established
            taking into consideration the need to carry out periodic
            maintenance to avoid costly rehabilitation. It must
            therefore be admitted that for some more years to come, an
            important part of the external assistance received will have
            to be allocated to periodic road maintenance and road rehabilitation.
